content:
Apple's stock price was initially affected by the pandemic, as many investors were concerned about the impact of the virus on the global economy and consumer spending. From February 19, 2020, to March 23, 2020, Apple's stock price dropped significantly, falling around 30%. 

However, Apple's stock price has rebounded since then, recovering much of the losses experienced in March. In fact, Apple has become the first U.S. company to reach a market value of $2 trillion after a surge in stock price in August 2020. This rise has been partly due to strong sales of iPhones and wearable technology, which have done well despite global economic challenges.

Overall, while the pandemic initially affected Apple's stock price, the company has weathered the storm and continued to perform well despite the challenges posed by COVID-19.
